docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Work in progress...

How to get started with Yomitan.

docs.title: Import to Yomitan
docs.text:
1. Download the .zip file
  2. Open Yomitan settings
  3. Go to "Dictionaries" → "Import"
  4. Select the downloaded .zip file

Or simply:

  1. Open Yomitan settings
  2. Go to "Dictionaries" → "Import"
  3. Paste the url in the box under the "Import dictionaries from URLs"

docs.title: Dictionary types
docs.text:
WIP. These are the different types of dictionaries that can be made with kty:

$ kty main              [OPTIONS] <SOURCE> <TARGET> [DICT_NAME]
$ kty ipa               [OPTIONS] <SOURCE> <TARGET> [DICT_NAME]
$ kty ipa-merged        [OPTIONS] <TARGET> [DICT_NAME]
$ kty glossary          [OPTIONS] <SOURCE> <TARGET> [DICT_NAME]
$ kty glossary-extended [OPTIONS] <EDITION> <SOURCE> <TARGET> [DICT_NAME]
  • main: main dictionaries, with etymology, examples etc. These have good coverage, but tend to be verbose.
  • glossary: short dictionaries made from Wiktionary translations section.
  • ipa: pronunciation dictionaries.

Reminder: roughly, the source is the language we learn. The target is the language we know.

Dictionary type Edition(s) Source Target main TARGET source TARGET ipa TARGET source TARGET ipa-merged ALL X target glossary SOURCE SOURCE target glossary-extended edition source target

Identical cells in a row are highlighted in bold UPPERCASE

docs.title: Paths
docs.text:
When building locally, dictionaries are usually stored in: ROOT/dict/SOURCE/TARGET/kty-SOURCE-TARGET.zip.

The only exception being ipa-merged, since it has no source.

$ kty main de en
✓ Wrote yomitan dict @ data/dict/de/en/kty-de-en.zip (16.05 MB)
$ kty glossary de en
✓ Wrote yomitan dict @ data/dict/de/en/kty-de-en-gloss.zip (3.58 MB)
$ kty ipa-merged en
✓ Wrote yomitan dict @ data/dict/en/all/kty-en-ipa.zip (4.45 MB)
$ kty glossary-extended all de en
✓ Wrote yomitan dict @ data/dict/de/en/kty-all-de-en-gloss.zip (2.70 MB)

docs.title: Language
docs.text:
Kaikki currently supports 20 Wiktionary editions. Most dictionaries use at least one edition.

For a list of targets supported by the English edition, see here.

For a list of supported languages by Yomitan, see here. If it is outdated, refer to here.

Missing a language? Please open an issue.

With Wiktionary Editions (20): 🇨🇳 Chinese, Mandarin zh, 🇨🇿 Czech cs, 🇳🇱 Dutch nl, 🇬🇧 English en, 🇫🇷 French fr, 🇩🇪 German de, 🇬🇷 Greek el, 🇮🇩 Indonesian id, 🇮🇹 Italian it, 🇯🇵 Japanese ja, 🇰🇷 Korean ko, 🇮🇶 Kurdish ku, 🇲🇾 Malay ms, 🇵🇱 Polish pl, 🇵🇹 Portuguese pt, 🇷🇺 Russian ru, 🇪🇸 Spanish es, 🇹🇭 Thai th, 🇹🇷 Turkish tr, 🇻🇳 Vietnamese vi

All Supported (70): 🇦🇱 Albanian sq, 🇪🇬 Arabic, Egyptian arz, 🇦🇪 Arabic, Gulf afb, 🟩 Arabic, MSA ar, 🇱🇧 Arabic, North Levantine apc, 🇯🇴 Arabic, South Levantine ajp, 🌞 Assyrian Neo-Aramaic aii, 🇧🇩 Bengali bn, 🇧🇬 Bulgarian bg, 🏳️ Cantonese yue, 🇨🇳 Chinese, Mandarin zh, 🇨🇿 Czech cs, 🇩🇰 Danish da, 🇳🇱 Dutch nl, 🇬🇧 English en, 🏰 English, Middle enm, 🗡️ English, Old ang, 🌍 Esperanto eo, 🇪🇪 Estonian et, 🇫🇮 Finnish fi, 🇫🇷 French fr, 🇬🇪 Georgian ka, 🇩🇪 German de, 🇬🇷 Greek el, 🏺 Greek, Ancient grc, 🏝️ Hawaiian haw, 🇮🇱 Hebrew he, 🇮🇳 Hindi hi, 🇭🇺 Hungarian hu, 🇮🇸 Icelandic is, 🇮🇩 Indonesian id, 🇮🇪 Irish ga, 🍀 Irish, Old sga, 🇮🇹 Italian it, 🇯🇵 Japanese ja, 🇮🇳 Kannada kn, 🇰🇿 Kazakh kk, 🇰🇭 Khmer km, 🇰🇷 Korean ko, 🇮🇶 Kurdish ku, 🇱🇦 Lao lo, 🏛 Latin la, 🇱🇻 Latvian lv, 🇲🇾 Malay ms, 🇲🇹 Maltese mt, 🇮🇳 Marathi mr, 🇲🇳 Mongolian mn, 🇳🇴 Norwegian no, 🇳🇴🏙️ Norwegian, Bokmål nb, 🇳🇴🌲 Norwegian, Nynorsk nn, 🇮🇷 Persian fa, 🇵🇱 Polish pl, 🇵🇹 Portuguese pt, 🇷🇴 Romanian ro, 🇷🇺 Russian ru, 🇷🇸🇭🇷 Serbo-Croatian sh, 🍋 Sicilian scn, 🇸🇮 Slovene sl, 🇪🇸 Spanish es, 🇸🇪 Swedish sv, 🇵🇭 Tagalog tl, 🇮🇳 Telugu te, 🇹🇭 Thai th, 🗣️ Toki Pona tok, 🇹🇷 Turkish tr, 🇺🇦 Ukrainian uk, 🇵🇰 Urdu ur, 🇻🇳 Vietnamese vi, 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁷󠁬󠁳󠁿 Welsh cy, 🏳️ Yiddish yi

docs.title: How to update a dictionary
docs.text:
Work in progress...

  1. Click on check for updates
  2. Click on the ! mark next to any dictionary that has an update
  3. Click on update

Add a picture here, don't think yomitan covers it.

This should fetch the dictionary for a future release.

Explain this quote from here:

Be aware that non-English dictionaries generally contain fewer entries than their English counterparts. Even if your primary language is not English, you may consider also importing the English version for better coverage.
